title: 2014 Cheap Truck Challenge! 93' S10 vs 95' Grand Cherokee vs 75' International - Dirt Every Day 32

comments.author: Greg McKay

comments.text:
lol... cool show :) . I thought they all did respectable, but so true that 
4 wheel drive is a 'must' if you're ever going off road. (Good commercial 
for voodoo ropes and all kinds of jeeps too)...oh yes and the final lesson 
I learned (cuz I actually made that error once with a big ole' boat 77 
mercury) is "just say no" to offers of 'free' gas tanks.... :)

comments.author: a93h201

comments.text:
Chevy uses an actuator on the front end to engage the 4 wheel drive and 
those seem to be a pretty normal problem for a lot of people. I had a 97 
Z71 and I burned up about 4 of those actuators from chevy then I bought a 
manual cable to engage my 4 wheel drive. That didn't work so well either. 
It was hell to pull it because the bracket they give with the kit would 
bend and the cable was hard to pull. Then when you did get it locked into 
4x4, soon as you hit a rough spot and had to actually use the 4x4 the cable 
would give and it would kick it back down to 2 wheel drive and get me 
stuck. 3 motors (350 V8's), 7 transmissions (th350's), 4 4x4 actuators + a 
manual one, 2 ECU's, a rear end, 3 front drive shafts, the fuel gauge, the 
windshield wipers, and a drive shaft later I finally decided to sale my 
chevy. I bought a ford and drove it for 10 years and never once broke down 
and my ex wife put sugar in the gas tank. I own a Jeep cherokee now and 
it's never gave me a problem either. ﻿

 need help finding parts where are places I can get some. Its 4x4 slant 4 
cylinder all stock and original.﻿

comments.text:
I just found a 1985 4Runner with the solid front axle for $1550, Solid 
frame too, thing has handled great in the snow recently. Gotta say the old

comments.author: LegendsXXX2

comments.text:
Are you serious, you picked an s10 for your cheap truck.. You know how many 
older dodge power rams are out there for cheap as dirt? I picked up my 84 
dodge power ram 4x4 with a 3 speed automatic 727 with 33 inch mud tires on 
it for 1400 dollars, I put a complete 4 inch suspension system on it for 
700, that would leave you 1900 to upgrade the engine to get more power, a 
new cam with springs, new intake and carb and you still have 1000 to spare! 
You need power to win all these challenges.. You could also weld the rear 
end for free to make it a posi. This was the dumbest challenge I've ever 
seen... ﻿

comments.author: mike morlaes

comments.text:
Pull the diaphragm off the actuator that pulls the fwd cable & pull out the 
cable with a pair of vice grips and bend it and the front will stay locked 
and wala 4wd. Got snowed in for awhile so I got an old S10 up and running 
to find the 4wd didn't work. I would be damned if I was not getting out so 
I figured this out and used that pos s10 to get to and from my house for a 
week. ﻿
comments.author: Dasvigo Morgan

comments.text:
I don't understand some of the issues people have with Jeep. I have a 93 
Jeep Grand Cherokee with 230k with all original drive-train and suspension, 
and it's still going strong. It's my DD and weekend wheeler and its never 
left me stranded. Honestly, I think most the people who don't like them 
either never personally owned one, or are simply jealous.﻿

comments.text:
thanks for wasting my time, and yours. instead of an interesting video 
showing low buck capabilities of these vehicles, you rig and cobble a s-10 
together poorly with nothing working. basically a hobbled pos. could have 
gotten a working limited slip out a camaro for under $100 or welded the 
spiders together,  the cable mod to remove the vacuum actuator was one of 
the first things any serious wheeler would have done for less than 30 
bucks....why doing something poorly is standard fair instead of doing it 
right, and then making a video of it is something i don't understand.﻿
